title: Twin Lakes Airport (North Carolina)
text:
Twin Lakes Airport is a privately owned, public-use <a href="airport">airport</a> located five miles (8 km) northeast of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Mocksville%2C%20North%20Carolina">Mocksville</a>, in <a href="Davie%20County%2C%20North%20Carolina">Davie County</a>, <a href="North%20Carolina">North Carolina</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>.
Facilities and aircraft.
Twin Lakes Airport covers an area of and has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 9/27 with a 2,943 x 50 ft (897 x 15 m) <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface. For the 12-month period ending August 10, 2007, the airport had 30,000 aircraft operations, an average of 82 per day: 97% <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> and 3% <a href="military%20aviation">military</a>. At that time there were 92 aircraft based at this airport: 88% single-<a href="aircraft%20engine">engine</a>, 10% multi-engine, 1% <a href="helicopter">helicopter</a> and 1% <a href="Glider%20aircraft">glider</a>.
